questions.question_text:
The gas phase reaction $$2A(g) \rightleftharpoons {A_2}(g)$$ at 400 K has $$\Delta$$Go = + 25.2 kJ mol-1.

The equilibrium constant KC for this reaction is ________ $$\times$$ 10$$-$$2. (Round off to the Nearest Integer).

[Use : R = 8.3 J mol$$-$$1 K$$-$$1, ln 10 = 2.3 log10 2 = 0.30, 1 atm = 1 bar]

[antilog ($$-$$0.3) = 0.501]
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: The gas phase reaction $$2A(g) \rightleftharpoons {A_2}(g)$$ at 400 K has $$\Delta$$G^{o} = + 25.2 kJ mol^{-1}.The equilibrium constant K_{C} for this reaction is ________ $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$2}. (Round off to the Nearest Integer).[Use : R = 8.3 J mol^{$$-$$1} K^{$$-$$1}, ln 10 = 2.3 log_{10} 2 = 0.30, 1 atm = 1 bar][antilog ($$-$$0.3) = 0.501]

questions.question_text:
Define a relation R over a class of n $$\times$$ n real matrices A and B as 

"ARB iff there exists a non-singular matrix P such that PAP$$-$$1 = B". 

Then which of the following is true?
questions.subject: Mathematics

options.A: R is reflexive, transitive but not symmetric
options.B: R is symmetric, transitive but not reflexive.
options.C: R is reflexive, symmetric but not transitive

Let g : R $$ \to $$ R be given as g(x) = 2x $$-$$ 3. Then, the sum of all the values of x for which f$$-$$1(x) + g$$-$$1(x) = $${{13} \over 2}$$ is equal to :

$${\left[ {{{x + 1} \over {{x^{2/3}} - {x^{1/3}} + 1}} - {{x - 1} \over {x - {x^{1/2}}}}} \right]^{10}}$$, x $$\ne$$ 1, is equal to ____________.

questions.question_text:

xdy $$-$$ ydx = $$\sqrt {({x^2} - {y^2})} dx$$, x $$ \ge $$ 1, with y(1) = 0. If the area bounded by the line x = 1, x = e$$\pi$$, y = 0 and y = y(x) is $$\alpha$$e2$$\pi$$ + $$\beta$$, then the value of 10($$\alpha$$ + $$\beta$$) is equal to __________.

questions.question_text:
Let f : R $$ \to $$ R satisfy the equation f(x + y) = f(x) . f(y) for all x, y $$\in$$R and f(x) $$\ne$$ 0 for any x$$\in$$R. If the function f is differentiable at x = 0 and f'(0) = 3, then

questions.question_text:
A proton and an $$\alpha$$-particle, having kinetic energies Kp and K$$\alpha$$ respectively, enter into a magnetic field at right angles.

The ratio of the radii of trajectory of proton to that of $$\alpha$$-particle is 2 : 1. The ratio of Kp : K$$\alpha$$ is :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A proton and an $$\alpha$$-particle, having kinetic energies K_{p} and K_{$$\alpha$$} respectively, enter into a magnetic field at right angles.The ratio of the radii of trajectory of proton to that of $$\alpha$$-particle is 2 : 1. The ratio of K_{p} : K_{$$\alpha$$} is :

questions.question_text: An ideal gas in a cylinder is separated by a piston in such a way that the entropy of one part is S1 and that of the other part is S2. Given that S1 > S2. If the piston is removed then the total entropy of the system will be :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: An ideal gas in a cylinder is separated by a piston in such a way that the entropy of one part is S_{1} and that of the other part is S_{2}. Given that S_{1} > S_{2}. If the piston is removed then the total entropy of the system will be :

questions.question_text:
Which of the following statements are correct?

(A) Electric monopoles do not exist whereas magnetic monopoles exist.

(B) Magnetic field lines due to a solenoid at its ends and outside cannot be completely straight and confined.

(C) Magnetic field lines are completely confined within a toroid.

(D) Magnetic field lines inside a bar magnet are not parallel.

(E) $$\chi $$ = $$-$$1 is the condition for a perfect diamagnetic material, where x is its magnetic susceptibility.

Choose the correct answer from the options given below :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: Which of the following statements are correct?(A) Electric monopoles do not exist whereas magnetic monopoles exist.(B) Magnetic field lines due to a solenoid at its ends and outside cannot be completely straight and confined.(C) Magnetic field lines are completely confined within a toroid.(D) Magnetic field lines inside a bar magnet are not parallel.(E) $$\chi $$ = $$-$$1 is the condition for a perfect diamagnetic material, where x is its magnetic susceptibility.Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

questions.question_text: Two wires of same length and thickness having specific resistances 6$$\Omega$$ cm and 3$$\Omega$$ cm respectively are connected in parallel. The effective resistivity is $$\rho$$$$\Omega$$ cm. The value of $$\rho$$, to the nearest integer, is ____________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: Two wires of same length and thickness having specific resistances 6$$\Omega$$ cm and 3$$\Omega$$ cm respectively are connected in parallel. The effective resistivity is $$\rho$$$$\Omega$$ cm. The value of $$\rho$$, to the nearest integer, is ____________.

questions.question_text:
Consider a 72 cm long wire AB as shown in the figure. The galvanometer jockey is placed at P on AB at a distance x cm from A. The galvanometer shows zero deflection.


The value of x, to the nearest integer, is ___________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: Consider a 72 cm long wire AB as shown in the figure. The galvanometer jockey is placed at P on AB at a distance x cm from A. The galvanometer shows zero deflection.The value of x, to the nearest integer, is ___________.

questions.question_text: A galaxy is moving away from the earth at a speed of 286 kms$$-$$1. The shift in the wavelength of a redline at 630 nm is x $$\times$$ 10$$-$$10 m. The value of x, to the nearest integer, is ____________. [Take the value of speed of light c, as 3 $$\times$$ 108 ms$$-$$1]
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A galaxy is moving away from the earth at a speed of 286 kms^{$$-$$1}. The shift in the wavelength of a redline at 630 nm is x $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$10} m. The value of x, to the nearest integer, is ____________. [Take the value of speed of light c, as 3 $$\times$$ 10^{8} ms^{$$-$$1}]

questions.question_text: A ball of mass 4 kg, moving with a velocity of 10 ms$$-$$1, collides with a spring of length 8 m and force constant 100 Nm$$-$$1. The length of the compressed spring is x m. The value of x, to the nearest integer, is ____________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A ball of mass 4 kg, moving with a velocity of 10 ms^{$$-$$1}, collides with a spring of length 8 m and force constant 100 Nm^{$$-$$1}. The length of the compressed spring is x m. The value of x, to the nearest integer, is ____________.

questions.question_text:
Consider a water tank as shown in the figure. It's cross-sectional area is 0.4 m2. The tank has an opening B near the bottom whose cross-section area is 1 cm2. A load of 24 kg is applied on the water at the top when the height of the water level is 40 cm above the bottom, the velocity of water coming out the opening B is v ms-1.

The value of v, to the nearest integer, is ___________. [Take value of g to be 10 ms-2]
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: Consider a water tank as shown in the figure. It's cross-sectional area is 0.4 m^{2}. The tank has an opening B near the bottom whose cross-section area is 1 cm^{2}. A load of 24 kg is applied on the water at the top when the height of the water level is 40 cm above the bottom, the velocity of water coming out the opening B is v ms^{-1}.The value of v, to the nearest integer, is ___________. [Take value of g to be 10 ms^{-2}]

questions.question_text:
The radius of a sphere is measured to be (7.50 $$\pm$$ 0.85) cm. Suppose the percentage error in its volume is x. 

The value of x, to the nearest x, is __________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: The radius of a sphere is measured to be (7.50 $$\pm$$ 0.85) cm. Suppose the percentage error in its volume is x. The value of x, to the nearest x, is __________.

questions.question_text:
The projectile motion of a particle of mass 5 g is shown in the figure.


The initial velocity of the particle is $$5\sqrt 2 $$ ms-1 and the air resistance is assumed to be negligible. The magnitude of the change in momentum between the points A and B is x $$\times$$ 10-2 kgms-1. The value of x, to the nearest integer, is __________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: The projectile motion of a particle of mass 5 g is shown in the figure.The initial velocity of the particle is $$5\sqrt 2 $$ ms^{-1} and the air resistance is assumed to be negligible. The magnitude of the change in momentum between the points A and B is x $$\times$$ 10^{-2} kgms^{-1}. The value of x, to the nearest integer, is __________.

questions.question_text:
An infinite number of point charges, each carrying 1 $$\mu$$C charge, are placed along the y-axis at y = 1 m, 2 m, 4 m, 8 m ...............

The total force on a 1C point charge, placed at the origin, is x $$\times$$ 103 N.

The value of x, to the nearest integer, is __________. [Take $${1 \over {4\pi {\varepsilon _0}}} = 9 \times {10^9}$$ Nm2/C2]
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: An infinite number of point charges, each carrying 1 $$\mu$$C charge, are placed along the y-axis at y = 1 m, 2 m, 4 m, 8 m ...............The total force on a 1C point charge, placed at the origin, is x $$\times$$ 10^{3} N.The value of x, to the nearest integer, is __________. [Take $${1 \over {4\pi {\varepsilon _0}}} = 9 \times {10^9}$$ Nm^{2}/C^{2}]
